result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Trial Order, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on September 26th, 2022.

9:30 AM Defendant Reynold G Tovar in court.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Reynold G Tovar.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for status.
Defense requests 22CF882 be set for trial. The other cases will tagalong. 
Snapchat discovery is outstanding. State to send an offer on this case and a global offer. 
Court to issue trial scheduling order.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE NOT CALLED ON THE RECORD.
Defense is still looking for discovery.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:12 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Reynold G Tovar in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with victims A-C/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:01 AM Defendant Reynold G Tovar in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.
